oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Tinker Dave Beaty tombstone
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Tombstone of David "Tinker Dave" Beaty. Beaty was born in Fentress County, Tennessee, on Feb. 19, 1817. He was the son of George and Lydia Ann (Wilson) Beaty. He organized and led a guerrilla group, "Beaty's Independent Scouts," that fought for the Union. Although the group was officially received into Federal Service on Jan. 5, 1862, the individuals were never mustered in and never received pay from the U.S. Government. Beaty was part of the guerrilla war that raged on the Cumberland Plateau.
